Émile Boutroux.label: Emile Boutroux
Émile Boutroux.description: Étienne Émile Marie Boutroux was an eminent 19th century French philosopher of science and religion, and an historian of philosophy. He was a firm opponent of materialism in science. Wikipedia

Émile Meyerson.label: Émile Meyerson
Émile Meyerson.description: Émile Meyerson was a Polish-born French epistemologist, chemist, and philosopher of science. Meyerson was born in Lublin, Poland. He died in his sleep of a heart attack at the age of 74. Wikipedia

Abdolkarim Soroush.label: Abdolkarim Soroush
Abdolkarim Soroush.description: Abdolkarim Soroush, born Hosein Haj Faraj Dabbagh, is an Iranian thinker, reformer, Rumi scholar and a former professor of philosophy at the University of Tehran and Imam Khomeini International University. Wikipedia
Education: Chelsea College of Science and Technology

Abdulhakim Arvasi.label: Abdulhakim Arvasi
Abdulhakim Arvasi.description: Abdulhakim Arvasi or Sayyeed Abd al Haqeem-i Arvasi was a Sunni Islamic scholar. Wikipedia

Alan Watts.label: Alan Watts
Alan Watts.description: Alan Wilson Watts was a British-born philosopher, writer, and speaker, best known as an interpreter and populariser of Eastern philosophy for a Western audience. Wikipedia
Alan Watts.Died: November 16, 1973, Mount Tamalpais, California, United States

Aldo Capitini.label: Aldo Capitini
Aldo Capitini.description: Aldo Capitini was an Italian philosopher, poet, political activist, anti-Fascist and educator. He was one of the first Italians to take up and develop Mahatma Gandhi's theories of nonviolence and was known as "the Italian Gandhi". Wikipedia

Alexander Nehamas.label: Alexander Nehamas
Alexander Nehamas.description: Alexander Nehamas is Professor of Philosophy and Edmund N. Carpenter, II Class of 1943 Professor in the Humanities at Princeton University and a Fellow of the American Academy of Arts & Sciences. Wikipedia

Alexius Meinong.label: Alexius Meinong
Alexius Meinong.description: Alexius Meinong was an Austrian philosopher, a realist known for his unique ontology. He also made contributions to philosophy of mind and theory of value. Wikipedia

Algernon Sidney.label: Algernon Sydney
Algernon Sidney.description: Algernon Sidney or Sydney was an English politician and member of the Long Parliament. A republican political theorist, colonel, and commissioner of the trial of King Charles I of England, he opposed the king's execution. Wikipedia
Algernon Sidney.Died: December 7, 1683, Tower Hill, London, United Kingdom

Aurel Kolnai.label: Aurel Kolnai
Aurel Kolnai.description: Aurel Thomas Kolnai was a 20th-century philosopher and political theorist. Wikipedia

Barbara Aland.label: Barbara Aland
Barbara Aland.description: Barbara Aland, née Ehlers is a German theologian and was a Professor of New Testament Research and Church History at Westphalian Wilhelms-University of Münster until 2002. Wikipedia

Bernard Stiegler.label: Bernard Stiegler
Bernard Stiegler.description: Bernard Stiegler is a French philosopher at Goldsmiths, University of London and at the Université de Technologie de Compiègne. Wikipedia
Education: École des Hautes Études en Sciences Sociales

Bob Black.label: Bob Black
Bob Black.description: Robert Charles "Bob" Black, Jr. is an American anarchist. He is the author of the books The Abolition of Work and Other Essays, Beneath the Underground, Friendly Fire, Anarchy After Leftism, "Defacing the Currency," and numerous political essays. Wikipedia

Bracha L. Ettinger.label: Bracha L. Ettinger
Bracha L. Ettinger.description: Bracha Lichtenberg Ettinger, is a visual artist based in Paris and Tel Aviv. She is an influential painter, philosopher and psychoanalyst and writer. Wikipedia
Education: University of Paris VIII Vincennes - Saint-Denis

Brian Massumi.label: Brian Massumi
Brian Massumi.description: Brian Massumi is a Canadian social theorist, writer and philosopher. Massumi's research spans the fields of art, architecture, political theory, cultural studies and philosophy. Wikipedia
Books: A user's guide to capitalism and schizophrenia

Brand Blanshard.label: Brand Blanshard
Brand Blanshard.description: Percy Brand Blanshard was an American philosopher known primarily for his defense of reason. A powerful polemicist, by all accounts he comported himself with courtesy and grace in philosophical ... Wikipedia
Brand Blanshard.Died: November 19, 1987, New Haven, Connecticut, United States

Carl Cohen.label: Carl Cohen
Carl Cohen.description: Carl Cohen is Professor of Philosophy at the Residential College of the University of Michigan, in Ann Arbor, Michigan, USA. Wikipedia

Christian von Ehrenfels.label: Christian von Ehrenfels
Christian von Ehrenfels.description: Christian von Ehrenfels was an Austrian philosopher, and is known as one of the founders and precursors of Gestalt psychology. Wikipedia

Christoph von Sigwart.label: Christoph von Sigwart
Christoph von Sigwart.description: Christoph von Sigwart was a German philosopher and logician. He was the son of philosopher Heinrich Christoph Wilhelm Sigwart. Wikipedia

Claude Adrien Helvétius.label: Claude Adrien Helvétius
Claude Adrien Helvétius.description: Claude Adrien Helvétius was a French philosopher and littérateur. Wikipedia

David Gauthier.label: David Gauthier
David Gauthier.description: David Gauthier is a Canadian-American philosopher best known for his neo-Hobbesian social contract theory of morality, as laid out in his book Morals by Agreement. Wikipedia

Cornel West.label: Cornel West
Cornel West.description: Cornel Ronald West is an American philosopher, academic, activist, author, public intellectual, and prominent member of the Democratic Socialists of America. Wikipedia
Movies: The Private Lives of Pippa Lee
The Night James Brown Saved Boston
The After Party The Last Party 3

David Hartley (philosopher).label: David Hartley
David Hartley (philosopher).description: David Hartley was an English philosopher and founder of the Associationist school of psychology. Wikipedia

David Ray Griffin.label: David Ray Griffin
David Ray Griffin.description: David Ray Griffin is a retired American professor of philosophy of religion and theology. Along with John B. Cobb, Jr., he founded the Center for Process Studies in 1973, a research center of Claremont ... Wikipedia

Emerich de Vattel.label: Emer de Vattel
Emerich de Vattel.description: Emer de Vattel was a Swiss philosopher, diplomat, and legal expert whose theories laid the foundation of modern international law and political philosophy. He was born in Couvet in Neuchatel, Switzerland in 1714 and died in 1767 of edema. Wikipedia

Ernst Lohmeyer.label: Ernst Lohmeyer
Ernst Lohmeyer.description: Ernst Lohmeyer was a German scholar of the New Testament, evangelic theologian and Bible professor, executed by Soviet authorities occupying the former East Germany. Wikipedia

Friedrich Albert Lange.label: Friedrich Albert Lange
Friedrich Albert Lange.description: Friedrich Albert Lange, was a German philosopher and sociologist. Wikipedia
Books: History of Materialism and Critique of its Present Importance
History of Materialism and Criticism of Its Present Importance
The History of Materialism and Criticism of Its Present ImportanceMore

Friedrich Heinrich Jacobi.label: Friedrich Heinrich Jacobi
Friedrich Heinrich Jacobi.description: Friedrich Heinrich Jacobi was an influential German philosopher, literary figure, socialite, and the younger brother of poet Johann Georg Jacobi. Wikipedia
Books: The main philosophical writings and the novel Allwill

Gaetano Mosca.label: Gaetano Mosca
Gaetano Mosca.description: Gaetano Mosca was an Italian political scientist, journalist and public servant. He is credited with developing the Theory of Elitism and the doctrine of the Political class and is one of the three ... Wikipedia

Georg Henrik von Wright.label: Georg Henrik von Wright
Georg Henrik von Wright.description: Georg Henrik von Wright was a Finnish philosopher, who succeeded Ludwig Wittgenstein as professor at the University of Cambridge. He published in English, Finnish, German, and in Swedish. Wikipedia
Books: The tree of knowledge and other essays
Philosophy of Logic and Mathematics International Library of Philosophy

Héctor-Neri Castañeda.label: Hector-Neri Castañeda
Héctor-Neri Castañeda.description:
Héctor-Neri Castañeda was a Guatemalan philosopher and founder of the journal Noûs.
Born in San Vicente, Zacapa, Guatemala, he emigrated to the United States in 1948 and studied under Wilfrid Sellars ... Wikipedia

Han Ryner.label: Han Ryner
Han Ryner.description: Jacques Élie Henri Ambroise Ner, also known by the pseudonym Han Ryner, was a French individualist anarchist philosopher and activist and a novelist. Wikipedia

Hans Joas.label: Hans Joas
Hans Joas.description:
Hans Joas is a German sociologist and social theorist.
Joas is a Permanent Fellow at the University of Freiburg in Germany and Professor of Sociology and a Member of the Committee on Social Thought at the University of Chicago. Wikipedia

Hans Kamp.label: Hans Kamp
Hans Kamp.description: Johan Anthony Willem Kamp is a Dutch philosopher and linguist, responsible for introducing Discourse Representation Theory in 1981. Wikipedia

Hans Jonas.label: Hans Jonas
Hans Jonas.description:
Hans Jonas was a German-born philosopher who was, from 1955 to 1976, Alvin Johnson Professor of Philosophy at the New School for Social Research in New York City.
Jonas's writings were very influential in different spheres. Wikipedia
Hans Jonas.Died: February 5, 1993, New York City, New York, United States
Awards: Peace Prize of the German Book Trade

Hans Köchler.label: Hans Köchler
Hans Köchler.description: Hans Köchler is a professor of philosophy at the University of Innsbruck, Austria, and president of the International Progress Organization, a non-governmental organization in consultative status with the United Nations. Wikipedia

Hans Lipps.label: Hans Lipps
Hans Lipps.description: Hans Lipps was a German phenomenological and existentialist philosopher. Wikipedia

Hermann Graf Keyserling.label: Hermann Graf Keyserling
Hermann Graf Keyserling.description: Hermann Alexander Graf Keyserling was a Baltic German philosopher. Wikipedia

Hermann Ulrici.label: Hermann Ulrici
Hermann Ulrici.description: Hermann Ulrici was a German philosopher. He was co-editor of the philosophical journal Zeitschrift für Philosophie und philosophische Kritik. He also wrote under the pseudonym of Ulrich Reimann. Wikipedia

Hubert Dreyfus.label: Hubert Dreyfus
Hubert Dreyfus.description: Hubert Lederer Dreyfus is an American philosopher and professor of philosophy at the University of California, Berkeley. Wikipedia
Hubert Dreyfus.Born: October 15, 1929 (age 84), Terre Haute, Indiana, United States

Ibn Kathir.label: Ibn Kathir
Ibn Kathir.description: Ismail ibn Kathir ‎ was a highly influential Muslim Muhaddith, Faqīh, Mufassir, and Historian. He was the author of Signs Before the Day of Judgment. He is also well known for his tafsir, which is widely considered authoritative. Wikipedia

Immanuel Hermann Fichte.label: Immanuel Hermann Fichte
Immanuel Hermann Fichte.description: Immanuel Hermann von Fichte was a German philosopher and son of Johann Gottlieb Fichte. In his philosophy, he was a theist and strongly opposed to the Hegelian School. Wikipedia

Jakob Böhme.label: Jakob Böhme
Jakob Böhme.description: Jakob Böhme was a German Christian mystic and theologian. He is considered an original thinker within the Lutheran tradition, and his first book, commonly known as Aurora, caused a great scandal. Wikipedia
Jakob Böhme.Born: March 8, 1575, Sulików, Lower Silesian Voivodeship, Poland

Jean-Luc Marion.label: Jean-Luc Marion
Jean-Luc Marion.description: Jean-Luc Marion is a postmodern philosopher and a former student of Jacques Derrida. Marion's work is informed by patristic and mystical theology, phenomenology, and modern philosophy. Wikipedia

Jeremy Rifkin.label: Jeremy Rifkin
Jeremy Rifkin.description: Jeremy Rifkin is an economic and social theorist, writer, public speaker, political advisor and activist. Wikipedia
Education: Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania

Jeremy Shearmur.label: Jeremy Shearmur
Jeremy Shearmur.description: Jeremy Shearmur was a Reader in Philosophy in the School of Philosophy at the Australian National University, until his retirement at the end of 2013. Wikipedia
Education: London School of Economics and Political Science
Books: Scaling the Ivory Tower The Pursuit of an Academic Career
The Political Thought of Karl Popper

Jesús Padilla Gálvez.label: Jesús Padilla Gálvez
Jesús Padilla Gálvez.description: Jesús Padilla Gálvez is a philosopher who worked primarily in philosophy of language, logic, and the history of sciences. Wikipedia

Johannes Nikolaus Tetens.label: Johannes Nikolaus Tetens
Johannes Nikolaus Tetens.description:
Johannes Nikolaus Tetens was a German philosopher, statistician and scientist.
He has been called 'the German Hume', on the basis of a comparison of his major work Philosophische Versuche über die ... Wikipedia

John Colet.label: John Colet
John Colet.description:
John Colet was an English churchman and educational pioneer.
Colet was an English scholar, Renaissance humanist, theologian, and Dean of St. Paul’s Cathedral, London. Colet wanted people to see the scripture as their guide through life. Wikipedia

John Hick.label: John Hick
John Hick.description: John Harwood Hick was a philosopher of religion and theologian born in England who taught in the United States for the larger part of his career. Wikipedia
John Hick.Born: January 20, 1922, Scarborough, North Yorkshire, United Kingdom

John McDowell.label: John McDowell
John McDowell.description: John Henry McDowell is a South African philosopher, formerly a fellow of University College, Oxford and now University Professor at the University of Pittsburgh. Wikipedia

John Wycliffe.label: John Wycliffe
John Wycliffe.description: John Wycliffe was an English Scholastic philosopher, theologian, lay preacher, translator, reformer and university teacher at Oxford in England, who was known as an early dissident in the Roman Catholic Church during the 14th century. Wikipedia

Jules Vuillemin.label: Jules Vuillemin
Jules Vuillemin.description: Jules Vuillemin was a French philosopher, succeeding to Maurice Merleau-Ponty at the Collège de France from 1962 to his death. A friend of Michel Foucault, he supported his election at the Collège, and was also close to Michel Serres. Wikipedia

Keith Ward.label: Keith Ward
Keith Ward.description: Keith Ward is a British philosopher, theologian, pastor and scholar. He is a Fellow of the British Academy and an ordained priest of the Church of England. He was a canon of Christ Church, Oxford until 2003. Wikipedia

Jun Tsuji.label: Jun Tsuji
Jun Tsuji.description: Jun Tsuji, later Ryūkitsu Mizushima was a Japanese author a poet, essayist, playwright, and translator. He has also been described as a Dadaist, nihilist, epicurean, shakuhachi musician, actor, feminist, and bohemian. Wikipedia

Jonathan Dancy.label: Jonathan Dancy
Jonathan Dancy.description: Jonathan Peter Dancy is a British philosopher, working on epistemology and on ethics. He is currently Professor Emeritus at the University of Reading and Professor of Philosophy at University of Texas at Austin. Wikipedia

Leszek Kołakowski.label: Leszek Kołakowski
Leszek Kołakowski.description: Leszek Kołakowski was a Polish philosopher and historian of ideas. He is best known for his critical analyses of Marxist thought, especially his three-volume history, Main Currents of Marxism. Wikipedia
Awards: Peace Prize of the German Book Trade

Kostas Axelos.label: Kostas Axelos
Kostas Axelos.description: Kostas Axelos was a Greek-French philosopher. Wikipedia

Kurt Aland.label: Kurt Aland
Kurt Aland.description: Kurt Aland was a German Theologian and Biblical Scholar who specialized in New Testament textual criticism. He founded the Institut für neutestamentliche Textforschung in Münster and served as its first director for many years. Wikipedia
Books: problem of the New Testament canon

Lon L. Fuller.label: Lon L. Fuller
Lon L. Fuller.description: Lon Luvois Fuller was a noted legal philosopher, who wrote The Morality of Law in 1964, discussing the connection between law and morality. Wikipedia

Knud Ejler Løgstrup.label: Knud Ejler Løgstrup
Knud Ejler Løgstrup.description: Knud Ejler Løgstrup was a Danish philosopher and theologian. His work, which combines elements of phenomenology, ethics and theology, has exerted considerable influence in postwar Nordic thought. Wikipedia

Mary Daly.label: Mary Daly
Mary Daly.description: Mary Daly was an American radical feminist philosopher, academic, and theologian. Daly, who described herself as a "radical lesbian feminist", taught at Boston College, a Jesuit-run institution, for 33 years. Wikipedia
Mary Daly.Born: October 16, 1928, Schenectady, New York, United States

Martha Fineman.label: Martha Albertson Fineman
Martha Fineman.description: Martha Albertson Fineman is an American jurist and legal theorist, known for her work in feminist legal theory and family law. She is Robert W. Woodruff Professor of Law at Emory University School of Law. Wikipedia

Lex Hixon.label: Lex Hixon
Lex Hixon.description: Lex Hixon was an American Sufi author, poet, and spiritual teacher. He practiced and held membership in several of the world's major great religious traditions, and documented his spiritual explorations ... Wikipedia
Lex Hixon.Died: November 1, 1995, Riverdale, New York City, New York, United States

Michael Hardt.label: Michael Hardt
Michael Hardt.description: Michael Hardt is an American literary theorist and political philosopher. Hardt is perhaps best known for his book Empire, which was co-written with Antonio Negri. It has been praised by some as the "Communist Manifesto of the 21st Century". Wikipedia

Murray Bookchin.label: Murray Bookchin
Murray Bookchin.description: Murray Bookchin was an American anarchist and libertarian socialist author, orator and political theoretician. Wikipedia
Murray Bookchin.Born: January 14, 1921, New York City, New York, United States

Muhammad Husayn Tabatabaei.label: Muhammad Husayn Tabatabaei
Muhammad Husayn Tabatabaei.description: Muhammad Husayn Tabatabaei or Seyed Mohammad Hossein Tabatabaei was one of the most prominent thinkers of philosophy and contemporary Shia Islam. He is famous for Tafsir al-Mizan, the Quranic exegesis. Wikipedia

Musa al-Sadr.label: Musa al-Sadr
Musa al-Sadr.description: Mūsá aṣ-Ṣadr was an Iranian-Lebanese philosopher and Shī‘ah religious leader who disappeared in August 1978. Wikipedia

Ned Block.label: Ned Block
Ned Block.description: Ned Joel Block is an American philosopher working in the field of the philosophy of mind who has made important contributions to matters of consciousness and cognitive science. Wikipedia

Nikolai Berdyaev.label: Nikolai Berdyaev
Nikolai Berdyaev.description: Nikolai Alexandrovich Berdyaev was a Russian religious and political philosopher. Wikipedia

Nicola Abbagnano.label: Nicola Abbagnano
Nicola Abbagnano.description: Nicola Abbagnano was an Italian existential philosopher. Wikipedia

Norman Malcolm.label: Norman Malcolm
Norman Malcolm.description: Norman Malcolm was an American philosopher. Wikipedia

Peter Blau.label: Peter Blau
Peter Blau.description: Peter Michael Blau was an American sociologist and theorist. Born in Vienna, Austria, he immigrated to the United States in 1939. Wikipedia

Philippe Lacoue-Labarthe.label: Philippe Lacoue-Labarthe
Philippe Lacoue-Labarthe.description:
Philippe Lacoue-Labarthe was a French philosopher. He was also a literary critic and translator.
Lacoue-Labarthe was influenced by and wrote extensively on Martin Heidegger, Jacques Derrida, Jacques ... Wikipedia

Philippa Foot.label: Philippa Foot
Philippa Foot.description: Philippa Ruth Foot was a British philosopher, most notable for her works in ethics. She was one of the founders of contemporary virtue ethics, that was originally based on the ethics of Aristotle. Wikipedia

Omraam Mikhaël Aïvanhov.label: Omraam Mikhaël Aïvanhov
Omraam Mikhaël Aïvanhov.description: Omraam Mikhaël Aïvanhov was a Macedonia-born Bulgarian philosopher, pedagogue, alchemist, mystic, magus and astrologer. Wikipedia

Phillip Blond.label: Phillip Blond
Phillip Blond.description: Phillip Blond is an English political philosopher, Anglican theologian and director of the ResPublica think tank. Wikipedia

René Guénon.label: René Guénon
René Guénon.description: René Guénon, also known as Shaykh 'Abd al-Wahid Yahya, was a French author and intellectual who remains an influential figure in the domain of metaphysics, having written on topics ranging from ... Wikipedia

Raya Dunayevskaya.label: Raya Dunayevskaya
Raya Dunayevskaya.description: Raya Dunayevskaya was the American founder of the philosophy of Marxist Humanism in the United States of America. Wikipedia
Books: Marxism and Freedom From 1776 Until Today
Twenty-Five Years of Marxist-Humanism in the U. S. A History of Worldwide Revolutionary DevelopmentsMore

Rein Raud.label: Rein Raud
Rein Raud.description: Rein Raud is an Estonian scholar and author. He was born in 1961 in the family of Eno Raud and Aino Pervik, both writers for children. Wikipedia

Robert Brandom.label: Robert Brandom
Robert Brandom.description: Robert Boyce Brandom is an American philosopher who teaches at the University of Pittsburgh. He works primarily in philosophy of language, philosophy of mind and philosophical logic, and his work ... Wikipedia

Richard Swinburne.label: Richard Swinburne
Richard Swinburne.description: Richard G. Swinburne is a British philosopher of religion. He is an Emeritus Professor of Philosophy at the University of Oxford. Wikipedia

Roberto Esposito.label: Roberto Esposito
Roberto Esposito.description: Roberto Esposito is an Italian philosopher, who is important for his work in biopolitics. He has been featured in the Summer 2006 issue of the journal Diacritics and the Fall 2013 special issue of Angelaki. Wikipedia

Robert B. Pippin.label: Robert B. Pippin
Robert B. Pippin.description: Robert Buford Pippin is an American philosopher. He is the Evelyn Stefansson Nef Distinguished Service Professor in the John U. Nef Committee on Social Thought, the Department of Philosophy, and the College at the University of Chicago. Wikipedia

Roberto Mangabeira Unger.label: Roberto Mangabeira Unger
Roberto Mangabeira Unger.description: Roberto Mangabeira Unger is a Brazilian philosopher, social theorist, and politician. His writings offer a comprehensive view of our humanity, and present a path by which humankind and each individual can hope to rise to a greater life. Wikipedia
Roberto Mangabeira Unger.Born: March 24, 1947 (age 67), Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
Education: Federal University of Rio de Janeiro Faculty of Law

Ronald Dworkin.label: Ronald Dworkin
Ronald Dworkin.description: Ronald Myles Dworkin, FBA was an American philosopher and scholar of constitutional law. He was Frank Henry Sommer Professor of Law and Philosophy at New York University and Emeritus Professor of ... Wikipedia
Ronald Dworkin.Born: December 11, 1931, Providence, Rhode Island, United States

Sergei Anatolyevich Starostin.label: Sergei Anatolyevich Starostin
Sergei Anatolyevich Starostin.description: Sergei Anatolyevich Starostin was a Russian historical linguist, perhaps best known for his reconstructions of hypothetical proto-languages, including his work on the controversial Altaic theory, the ... Wikipedia

Sidney Hook.label: Sidney Hook
Sidney Hook.description: Sidney Hook was an American philosopher of the Pragmatist school known for his contributions to the philosophy of history, the philosophy of education, political theory, and ethics. Wikipedia
Sidney Hook.Born: December 20, 1902, Brooklyn, New York, United States

Susanne Langer.label: Susanne Katherina Langer
Susanne Langer.description: Susanne Katherina Langer was an American philosopher of mind and of art who was influenced by Ernst Cassirer and Alfred North Whitehead. Wikipedia
Susanne Langer.Born: December 20, 1895, New York City, New York, United States
Susanne Langer.Died: July 17, 1985, Old Lyme, Connecticut, United States
Nominations: National Book Award for The Sciences

Sufyan al-Thawri.label: Sufyan al-Thawri
Sufyan al-Thawri.description: Sufyan ath-Thawri ibn Said was a tabi'i Islamic scholar, Hafiz and jurist, founder of the Thawri madhhab. He was also a hadith compiler, of whom a great number of anecdotes are recorded. Wikipedia

Samuel Bailey.label: Samuel Bailey
Samuel Bailey.description: Samuel Bailey was a British philosopher and writer. He was called the "Bentham of Hallamshire". Wikipedia
Books: On the Received Text of Shakespeare's Dramatic Writings and Its Improvement

Teodor Oizerman.label: Teodor Oizerman
Teodor Oizerman.description:
Teodor Ilyich Oizerman is a Soviet and Russian philosopher and academician.
Oizerman was born in Petroverovka village, Tiraspol uyezd, Kherson Governorate, Russian Empire, in a Jewish family. His parents were teachers. Wikipedia

William Frankena.label: William Frankena
William Frankena.description: William K. Frankena was an American moral philosopher. He was a member of the University of Michigan's department of philosophy for 41 years, and chair of the department for 14 years. Wikipedia
William Frankena.Died: October 22, 1994, Ann Arbor, Michigan, United States

Zhou Dunyi.label: Zhou Dunyi
Zhou Dunyi.description: Zhou Dunyi, formerly romanized Chou Tun-i, was a Chinese Neo-Confucian philosopher and cosmologist born in present-day Yongzhou during the Song Dynasty. Wikipedia
